column4: I'm using the nvidia config tool to tell it to output to s-video. how can I get it to be done automaticlly on startup?
go to System->Preferences->Sessions. Click Add and type in a name (it doesn't matter what) and the terminal command you want to run at startup
the thing is I only know how to do that from the GUI, not from command line
hold on, I think I know the command...
try "sudo nvidia-settings" restart your session, come back here if it doesn't work
here's the issue: I won't have a screen connected to it, just s-video output to my TV
Oh, so you want the default video out to be to s-video?
now, everytime I restart it disables the TV screen and I have to set it up every time I restart
gimme a minute, I'll try to find something.
where in nvidia-settings are the options you want to enable?
than I select TV-OUT, configure, set to "twin view"
after you set those, did you click "Save to X Configuration File" ?
ok, if it doesn't work, be sure to come back here. =)
